summary: AI-powered nutrition assistant that parses free-form meal text prompts and fetches nutrition facts (calories/macros) from web/Chrome sources, returning a human-style summary with reasonable portion assumptions (e.g., slices vs 100g).
architectural_notes: Need a nutrition data retrieval layer (web search/Chrome scraping/API) feeding an LLM summarizer, with portion/quantity normalization (packet/slice/grams).
known_issues: Current model/flow misinterprets portions (e.g., defaults cheese to ~100g) instead of using implied units like slices, leading to incorrect nutrition totals.

existing_features.title: Update the free-text meal parsing flow to support portion-aware quantities (e.g., slices, packets, tablespoons, grams) instead of defaulting foods like cheese to 100g when the user input implies a different unit (e.g., "2 cheese slices").

Add a web-based nutrition lookup step (no paid/keys required) to fetch calories/protein/sugar from public online sources before falling back to the local nutrition database, so results feel "grabbed from Chrome" rather than purely estimated.

Change the Quick Log (Description) result UI to present a Chrome-like breakdown for multi-item meals: list each recognized food item with its interpreted quantity plus calories and protein (and sugar when available), and show totals for the full meal.

Update the food enrichment logic so it can enrich multiple parsed food items in one prompt and generate a human-style English summary similar to the assistantâ€™s earlier response (bullet-like breakdown + totals) while keeping the saved data consistent.

new_feature_requests.summary: Support free-form meal prompts and return a structured nutrition summary (calories + protein at minimum) with sensible portion interpretation (e.g., cheese slice vs 100g).
Integrate web/Chrome-based nutrition lookup (or external AI/web search) to fetch nutrition data automatically from online sources and use it in the summary.

projectName: Improve meal prompt parsing with portion-aware nutrition lookup and Chrome-like summary output
